definition[0]: to succeed in making progress with something
example[0]: The new team have to carry the work forward.
definition[1]: to include an amount of money in a later set of figures or calculations
definition[2]: to take an amount forward to the next account or to a later page in the account book
example[1]: The average assets carried forward from season to season varied from minus $630,000 to plus $770,000.
definition[3]: if you carry forward a loss or other amount not used in a particular accounting period, you use it in the next accounting period in order to reduce the amount of tax you have to pay
example[2]: Taxpayers were allowed to deduct losses carried forward from previous years from their net income.
